intro: Protium avilense var. santanderense, commonly known as the Santander protium, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the Andean regions of Colombia. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its elliptical, glossy leaves and fragrant, yellowish-green flowers. The tree produces small, smooth, yellow fruits that contain a single seed. It is often found in humid, shaded understories of montane forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
